content:
## How do I call a method?

In Java, we use dot notation ( `.`(#e7e8ea) ) to access the methods of an object or class.

A method is called using the following syntax:

  ```
  nameOfObject.nameOfMethod();
  
  OR
  
  nameOfObject.nameOfMethod(argument);
  ```

Be sure to replace `nameOfObject`(#e7e8ea) with the name of the object and `nameOfMethod`(#e7e8ea) with the name of the method you want to use.

If the method you want to use requires an argument, include the value you want to use inside the parentheses.
